intro.description: This Cheat Sheet will explain how to create a hierarchical structure of tags and how to apply them to Test Items.

item.title: Show the Tag view
item.description: Click on the Tag tab in the bottom view pane. You should see some example Tags under the title "Basic Grammar".

item.title: Add a new Tag Category
item.description: Right click on the Tag View and choose Add Tag.

subitem.label: Choose the Category that you want the new Category to be under. If you choose / then it will appear at the top level.
Type an Id for the tag. e.g. Level

You can give it a different name from the ID and specify the language for the name. This is only useful if you are using the software with users of several languages and want to reuse the same Tag ID with an appropriate Name in each language.
Click OK to finish adding the new tag category.

item.title: Add a new Tag
item.description: Right click on the Tag that you just created and choose Add. The Category should already be the Tag that you clicked on. You can then give it an ID and Name as before. e.g. If you created a top level category of "Level", you might create a tag called "Basic".

item.title: How to Tag Test Items
item.description: Open the Test Module Editor by double clicking on a Test Module in the Navigator view, if it is not already open.

subitem.label: Select the Test Item that you want to Tag in the Editor pane.
Click the tick-box in the Tag view beside the relevant tags.
Repeat this for each Test Item in the Module

item.title: Searching
item.description: You can find all the Test Items which are marked with a certain tag by right clicking on that tag and choosing Search for References.

item.title: Filtering a Test by Tag
item.description: The Start Test Wizard has a page that allows you to filter by Tag. Tick Enable Filter by Tag and choose the tags that you want to be tested on.
